snippet: Players at one of the only Jewish religious schools in the nation to play the varsity sport reserve Friday evenings for Shabbat dinner. But the night before is set aside for the gridiron.
abstract: Samuel G Freedman On Religion column on football team the Hurricanes at Scheck Hillel Community School in North Miami Beach, Fla, one of the only Jewish religious schools in nation to play the varsity sport; notes since players reserve Friday evenings for Shabat dinner, their gridiron action takes place under Thursday night lights.
lead_paragraph: Players at one of the only Jewish religious schools in the nation to play the varsity sport reserve Friday evenings for Shabbat dinner. But the night before is set aside for the gridiron.

headline.print_headline: For Jewish School’s Football Team, It’s Thursday Night Lights
headline.main: For Jewish School’s Football Team, It’s Thursday Night Lights
